name: ImageToolbox
description: üñºÔ∏è Image Toolbox is a powerful app for advanced image manipulation. It offers dozens of features, from basic tools like crop and draw to filters, OCR, and a wide range of image processing options
readme_summary: Image Toolbox is a powerful Android application built with Kotlin and Jetpack Compose, offering advanced image manipulation capabilities. It provides a wide array of features, from basic editing tools to sophisticated AI-powered functions like background removal and upscaling.
primary_use_case: Advanced image editing and manipulation on Android devices.
cover_image_prompt: A digital artist's workbench, overflowing with a diverse array of tools and materials. In the center, a glowing tablet displays a complex image being transformed. One side of the tablet shows a 'before' image with various imperfections, while the other side shows a polished 'after' image. Tools like a magnifying glass (for OCR), scissors (for cropping), paintbrushes (for drawing), and a digital wand emitting particles (for AI enhancements like upscaling and background removal) are scattered around. Subtle UI elements and code snippets are visible on small floating screens. The 'Image Toolbox' logo is subtly integrated into the workbench. The style is a vibrant, 3D isometric illustration with a clean, organized composition and bright, inviting lighting.

name: LiveContainer
description: Run iOS apps without actually installing them!
readme_summary: LiveContainer is an app launcher for iOS that allows users to run multiple iOS applications without needing to install each one individually. It bypasses typical app installation limits and signing requirements, especially when Just-In-Time (JIT) compilation is available, offering a way to manage and launch apps more flexibly.
key_features: Run iOS apps without installing them
Install unlimited apps with a single app ID
Support for multiple versions of an app with separate data containers
JIT-less mode for app signing using LiveContainer's certificate
primary_use_case: Running multiple iOS applications on a device without adhering to standard installation or app ID limitations, particularly for development or testing purposes.
cover_image_prompt: A vibrant, stylized illustration of a user's hand holding a magical, open book labeled 'LiveContainer'. Inside the book, instead of pages, are miniature, fully functional iOS app icons floating and glowing. The hand is gently placing a new app icon into the book, which seamlessly integrates. Around the book, a few other app icons are shown in small, distinct 'containers' with subtle digital energy flowing between them, representing separate data. The background is a clean, modern interface with soft, ambient lighting, hinting at a digital space. The overall mood is one of effortless management and boundless possibility for app launching.

name: DrawPen
description: DrawPen is a simple screen annotation. Available on macOS, Windows & Linux.
readme_summary: DrawPen is an open-source screen annotation tool available for macOS, Windows, and Linux. It allows users to draw, add shapes, text, and highlights directly on their screen, with a laser pointer and eraser functionality for presentations and general annotation needs.
key_features: Drawing, shapes, text, and highlighter tools
Global keyboard shortcuts for quick access
primary_use_case: Annotating the screen during presentations, tutorials, or general screen sharing to highlight information or add visual cues.
cover_image_prompt: A friendly, stylized hand holding a glowing digital pen, drawing vibrant, translucent shapes and lines directly onto a projection of a computer screen. The screen displays a presentation slide with key points being circled and highlighted. Subtle UI elements like a color palette and brush size slider float near the hand. The background is a clean, modern workspace with a hint of digital particles flowing from the pen. The overall mood is creative and informative, emphasizing the ease of adding visual annotations. The art style should be a clean, 3D isometric illustration with bright, engaging colors, clearly showing the 'DrawPen' name subtly integrated into a floating toolbar.

name: picoshare
description: A minimalist, easy-to-host service for sharing images and other files
readme_summary: PicoShare is a minimalist, self-hostable file-sharing service written in Go. It provides direct download links for any file type and size without re-encoding or resizing, ensuring users receive their files exactly as uploaded. It supports local storage and cloud data replication via Litestream for persistence.
key_features: No resizing or re-encoding of media files
Optional cloud data replication with Litestream
primary_use_case: Self-hosting a simple and efficient file-sharing service for any type of file, with direct download links and no content modification.
cover_image_prompt: A minimalist, clean scene depicting a digital conveyor belt carrying various physical objects (a document, a photo, a video tape, an audio cassette) towards a sleek, modern portal. As each object passes through the portal, it emerges on the other side as a simple, clean digital icon representing its type, with a clear, direct download arrow emanating from it. The background is a soft, gradient blue, with subtle lines of code or data streams flowing gently in the distance. The overall mood is efficient and straightforward, emphasizing the direct transfer and accessibility of any file type. The style should be a 3D isometric illustration with a focus on clarity and simplicity, featuring the name 'PicoShare' subtly integrated into the portal's design.

name: Nook
description: A new browser, not owned by Atlassian.
readme_summary: Nook is a fast, minimal web browser for macOS designed with a unique sidebar-first interface. It prioritizes performance and a clean user experience, leveraging modern macOS APIs for efficiency.
key_features: Performance optimization with modern macOS APIs
Minimal and modern UI focused on content
primary_use_case: A desktop web browser for macOS with an alternative tab management interface.
cover_image_prompt: A minimalist, sleek desk setup on a modern macOS computer. Instead of a traditional browser window, a glowing, translucent sidebar on the left displays a series of organized, vertical tabs, each subtly representing a different website or task. The main screen area shows the content of the active tab, clean and uncluttered. A small, stylized 'Nook' logo hovers near the sidebar. The overall mood is efficient and calm, with soft ambient lighting. The style should be a clean, 3D isometric illustration with a focus on user interface elements and a cool, blue-toned color palette.
